column4: I'm at my wits' with this networking stuff in Ubuntu.  Unfortunately I'm about ready to just scrap the whole thing and go back to Windows...  :/
I'm trying to get my internet to work, and I've spent upwards of 10 hours reading the forums, to no avail.
No, I have a cable modem.
Yes.
It's a D-Link, and my IP is on a DMZ, so all ports or open.
Problem is that I can't even get to that point.  So far I haven't even been able to ping the router.
.. you are very trusting :)
go to system/administration/networking - is your ethernet active?
have you checked the configuration? is it set up for dhcp?
like arrick said... type ifconfig in a console...
... dhcp is better assuming your router is working properly
.. .if you've been working on it for hours you are on the wrong track.. best to take a break.. go cuddle your girlfriend for a while :)
... ubuntu networking is usually pretty good.. when you find the problem it will be pretty simple
... sounds like you are not talking to the router...
is the ip number all 000?
that is possibly your problem
.. i can't remember .. but i think you can switch that off
... your router probably only speaks ip v4
.. i'm not expert.. but i vaguely recall reading something about having to turn off ip v6
.. hunt around networking configs, ask here.. or try Mr.Google
